title: Garment, toy companies go full throttle as US buyers look beyond China
summary: US buyers are increasingly shifting their sourcing strategies away from China, leading to increased opportunities for garment and toy manufacturers in other regions. Companies are ramping up production to meet this growing demand as part of the China+1 diversification strategy.
content:
As US companies actively seek to diversify their supply chains beyond China, garment and toy manufacturers are experiencing a significant uptick in orders and opportunities. The shift is part of a broader China+1 strategy being adopted by American businesses looking to reduce their dependence on Chinese manufacturing.

Manufacturers in countries like Vietnam, India, Bangladesh, and Mexico are particularly benefiting from this transition, with many reporting substantial increases in order volumes. Garment factories are expanding their production capacity, while toy manufacturers are investing in new facilities to meet the growing demand.

This trend has been accelerated by various factors including rising labor costs in China, ongoing trade tensions between the US and China, and a desire for supply chain resilience following recent global disruptions.

Industry experts note that while China remains a significant manufacturing hub, the diversification of supply chains represents a long-term structural change in global trade patterns.
